project.name: CloudKid Animation API
project.description: CloudKid Animation API: A library for playing Animations

Animator.name: Animator
Animator.description:
Animator is a static class designed to provided
base animation functionality, using frame labels of MovieClips

AnimatorTimeline.name: AnimatorTimeline
AnimatorTimeline.description:
Animator Timeline is a class designed to provide
base animation functionality

cloudkid.BitmapMovieClip.name: cloudkid.BitmapMovieClip
cloudkid.BitmapMovieClip.description:
A class similar to createjs.MovieClip, but made to play animations from a cloudkid.TextureAtlas.
The CreateJS Sprite class requires a spritesheet with equal sized and spaced frames. By using cloudkid.TextureAtlas,
you can use a much smaller spritesheet, sprites on screen with fewer extra transparent pixels, and use the same
API as MovieClip.

params.name: atlas=null
params.description: The texture atlas to pull frames from.

params.name: data=null
params.description: Initialization data

params.name: data.fps
params.description: Framerate to play the movieclip at. Omitting this will use the current framerate.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: A dictionary of the labels in the movieclip to assist in playing animations.

params.name: [data.origin={x:0,
params.description: y:0}] The origin of the movieclip.

params.name: data.frames
params.description: An array of frame sequences to pull from the texture atlas.

params.name: data.frames.name
params.description: The name to use for the frame sequence. This should include a "#" to be replaced with the image number.

params.name: data.frames.min
params.description: The first frame number in the frame sequence.

params.name: data.frames.max
params.description: The last frame number in the frame sequence.

params.name: data.frames.digits
params.description: The maximum number of digits in the names of the frames, e.g. myAnim0001 has 4 digits.

params.name: data.scale
params.description:
The scale at which the art was exported, e.g. a scale of 1.4 means the art was increased
        in size to 140% before exporting and should be scaled back down before drawing to the screen.

Format for data:
	{
		fps:30,
		labels:
		{
			animStart:0,
			animStart_loop:15
		},
		origin:{ x: 20, y:30 },
		frames:
		[
			{
				name:"myAnim#",
				min:1,
				max:20,
				digits:4
			}
		],
		scale:1
	}

 The object describes a 30 fps animation that is 20 frames long, and was originally myAnim0001.png->myAnim0020.png,
 with frame labels on the first and 16th frame. 'digits' is optional, and defaults to 4.

CharacterClip.name: CharacterClip
CharacterClip.description: CharacterClip is used by the CharacterController class

params.name: event
params.description: Animator event to play

params.name: loops
params.description: The number of loops

CharacterController.name: CharacterController
CharacterController.description:
Character Controller class is designed to play animated
sequences on the timeline. This is a flexible way to
animate characters on a timeline

PixiAnimator.name: PixiAnimator
PixiAnimator.description: [PIXI Only] Animator for interacting with Spine animations

PixiAnimator.AnimTimeline.name: PixiAnimator.AnimTimeline
PixiAnimator.AnimTimeline.description: [Pixi Only] Internal PixiAnimator class for keeping track of animations

params.name: clip
params.description: The AnimTimeline's clip

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to call when the clip is finished playing

params.name: speed
params.description: The speed at which the clip should be played

params.name: image
params.description:
The image that all textures pull from.
     This can also be an array of images, if the TextureAtlas should be built from several spritesheets.

params.name: spritesheetData
params.description:
The JSON object describing the frames in the atlas.
     This is expected to fit the JSON Hash format as exported from TexturePacker.
     This can also be an array of data objects, if the TextureAtlas should be built from several spritesheets.

cloudkid.TextureAtlas.Texture.name: cloudkid.TextureAtlas.Texture
cloudkid.TextureAtlas.Texture.description: A Texture - a specific portion of an image that can then be drawn by a Bitmap.

classitems.description: Play an animation for a frame label event
classitems.name: play

params.name: instance
params.description: The timeline to animate

params.name: event
params.description: The frame label event (e.g. "onClose" to "onClose stop")

params.name: options
params.description: The object of optional parameters or onComplete callback function

props.name: onComplete
props.description: The callback function when the animation is done

props.name: onCompleteParams
props.description: Parameters to pass to onComplete function

props.name: startTime
props.description: The time in milliseconds into the animation to start. A value of -1 makes the animation play at a random startTime.

props.name: speed
props.description: The speed at which to play the animation.

props.name: soundData
props.description:
soundData Data about a sound to sync the animation to, as an alias or in the format {alias:"MyAlias", start:0}.
		start is the seconds into the animation to start playing the sound. If it is omitted or soundData is a string, it defaults to 0.

props.name: doCancelledCallback
props.description: Should an overridden animation's callback function still run?

classitems.description:
Determines if a given instance can be animated by Animator, to allow things that aren't
	MovieClips from EaselJS to be animated if they share the same API. Note - 'id' is a property with
	a unique value for each createjs.DisplayObject. If a custom object is made that does not inherit from DisplayObject,
	it needs to not have an id that is identical to anything from EaselJS.

return.description: If the instance can be animated or not.

classitems.name: currentFrame

classitems.description: If true, the BitmapMovieClip's position will not advance when ticked.
classitems.name: paused

classitems.description: If true, the BitmapMovieClip will advance its timeline during ticks. If false then it must be externally advanced.
classitems.name: advanceDuringTicks

classitems.description:
By default BitmapMovieClip instances advance one frame per tick. Specifying a framerate for the BitmapMovieClip
will cause it to advance based on elapsed time between ticks as appropriate to maintain the target
framerate.

For example, if a BitmapMovieClip with a framerate of 10 is placed on a Stage being updated at 40fps, then the BitmapMovieClip will
advance roughly one frame every 4 ticks. This will not be exact, because the time between each tick will
vary slightly between frames.

This feature is dependent on the tick event object (or an object with an appropriate "delta" property) being
passed into {{#crossLink "Stage/update"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: framerate

classitems.description: When the BitmapMovieClip is framerate independent, this is the time elapsed from frame 0 in seconds.
classitems.name: elapsedTime

classitems.description:
By default BitmapMovieClip instances advance one frame per tick. Specifying a framerate for the BitmapMovieClip
will cause it to advance based on elapsed time between ticks as appropriate to maintain the target
framerate.
classitems.name: _framerate

classitems.description: When the BitmapMovieClip is framerate independent, this is the total time in seconds for the animation.
classitems.name: _duration

classitems.description: When the BitmapMovieClip is framerate independent, this is the time elapsed from frame 0 in seconds.

classitems.description:
Returns true or false indicating whether the display object would be visible if drawn to a canvas.
This does not account for whether it would be visible within the boundaries of the stage.
NOTE: This method is mainly for internal use, though it may be useful for advanced uses.
classitems.name: isVisible

return.description: Boolean indicating whether the display object would be visible if drawn to a canvas

classitems.description:
Draws the display object into the specified context ignoring its visible, alpha, shadow, and transform.
Returns true if the draw was handled (useful for overriding functionality).
NOTE: This method is mainly for internal use, though it may be useful for advanced uses.
classitems.name: draw

params.name: ctx
params.description: The canvas 2D context object to draw into.

params.name: ignoreCache
params.description:
Indicates whether the draw operation should ignore any current cache.
For example, used for drawing the cache (to prevent it from simply drawing an existing cache back
into itself).

for more information.

classitems.description: Get an array of Textures that match a specific name.
classitems.name: getFrames

params.name: name
params.description:
The base name of all frames to look for, like "anim_#" to search for an animation exported
       as anim_0001.png (the ".png" is dropped when the TextureAtlas is loaded).

params.name: numberMin
params.description: The number to start on while looking for frames. Flash generally starts at 1.

params.name: numberMax
params.description:
The number to go until while looking for frames. 
       If your animation runs from frame 0001 to frame 0014, numberMax would be 14.

params.name: maxDigits
params.description: Maximum number of digits, like 4 for an animation exported as anim_0001.png

params.name: outArray
params.description: If already using an array, this can fill it instead of creating a new one.

classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the untrimmed texture.
